publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2418Margaret Smith:Congratulations to Chris Hoy—That the Parliament congratulates Edinburgh cyclist, Chris Hoy, on winning three gold medals at the 2008 Beijing Olympics; notes that he is the first Briton to win three gold medals at the same Olympics in 100 years; recognises that Hoy’s achievements in Olympic track cycling are exceptional; welcomes the inspiration generated as a result of this achievement; calls on the UK Government to bestow a knighthood on him, and wishes Chris the best of luck for the future and looks forward to further success in forthcoming events. Supported by: John Lamont*, Ken Macintosh*, Tavish Scott*, Nanette Milne*, Alasdair Allan*, Liam McArthur*, Elaine Smith*
S3M-2418 Congratulations to Chris Hoy (lodged on 21 August 2008) Cathy Peattie*, Mike Pringle*, Jamie McGrigor*, Michael Matheson*, Hugh O’Donnell*
S3M-2418 Congratulations to Chris Hoy (lodged on 21 August 2008) Tom McCabe*, Rhoda Grant*
S3M-2418 Congratulations to Chris Hoy (lodged on 21 August 2008) Alex Johnstone*, Jim Tolson*, Mr Frank McAveety*
S3M-2418 Congratulations to Chris Hoy (lodged on 21 August 2008) Jamie Stone*
S3M-2418 Congratulations to Chris Hoy (lodged on 21 August 2008) Robin Harper*, Dr Richard Simpson*
S3M-2418 Congratulations to Chris Hoy (lodged on 21 August 2008) Gil Paterson*
S3M-2418 Congratulations to Chris Hoy (lodged on 21 August 2008) Shirley-Anne Somerville*
S3M-2418 Congratulations to Chris Hoy (lodged on 21 August 2008) Angela Constance*
